sentences.en: {"COLLOINEXA":["entrance examinations"]}
sentences.cn: 入学考试

sentences.en: A marble entrance hall leads to a sitting room.
sentences.cn: 大理石门厅通往起居室。

sentences.en: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.cn: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

sentences.en: He made his entrance into the parade ring.
sentences.cn: 他走向赛马准备区。

sentences.en: His entrance was announced by a buzzer connected to the door.
sentences.cn: 他刚一进去，与门相连的门铃便嗡嗡作响。

sentences.en: I was entranced by the sweetness of her voice.
sentences.cn: 她甜美的嗓音令我陶醉。

sentences.en: On one side of the main entrance there's a red plaque.
sentences.cn: 大门口的一侧有块红色的匾额。

sentences.en: She had meant to make a discreet entrance, but conversation stopped dead.
sentences.cn: 她本打算悄悄进去，但谈话却突然中断了。

sentences.en: The entrance fee is £50.
sentences.cn: 门票是50英镑。

sentences.en: The entrance hall is littered with toys and wellington boots.
sentences.cn: 门厅里到处乱扔着玩具和雨靴。

sentences.en: The entrance is well signposted and is in Marbury Road.
sentences.cn: 入口处在马伯里路，有清晰的路标。

sentences.en: The entrance to the cave was infilled by the landowner.
sentences.cn: 山洞的入口被地产的主人给堵上了。

sentences.en: the initial interview for entrance to the Civil Service
sentences.cn: 报考公务员的面试初试

sentences.en: The old stone cattle trough still sits by the main entrance.
sentences.cn: 陈旧的石制牛食槽仍然放在大门口。

sentences.en: the station entrance
sentences.cn: 车站的入口处

sentences.en: The telephone was downstairs in the entrance hall.
sentences.cn: 电话在楼下的门厅里。

sentences.en: There is a telephone inside the entrance hall.
sentences.cn: 门厅内有部电话。

sentences.en: There were people at the entrance giving out leaflets.
sentences.cn: 有人在入口处散发传单。

sentences.en: They rushed the entrance and forced their way in.
sentences.cn: 他们猛冲到入口，强行闯入。

sentences.en: Young autograph hunters clustered around the players' entrance.
sentences.cn: 年轻人都挤在演员入口处索要签名。

words.tran_cn: 使人入神的；令人欣喜的
进入者；新会员；参加竞赛者；新工作者

phrases.tran_cn: 进口许可证；入境许可证；入境证
大门，正门入口；主要入口

trans.tran_cn: 入口，到达，登台，进入许可，入行资格，涉入
trans.tran_en: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place
if someone or something entrances you, they make you give them all your attention because they are so beautiful, interesting etc
